intro: Sterculia schliebenii, commonly known as the Schlieben's Sterculia, is a tropical tree native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous elliptical seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
